negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think we can both do well if we cooperate. I propose the following:

I will choose choice_2. If you also choose choice_2, we will both get a reward of 7, which is pretty good for both of us. Most of the other combinations lead to lower rewards on one or both sides.

If you agree to both play choice_2, we guarantee ourselves a solid outcome. Let me know what you think!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your proposal. I appreciate you suggesting we both play choice_2 to each get a reward of 7. 

However, I've analyzed the game and I believe I can do better by choosing choice_3. If I play choice_3, I'm guaranteed a reward of at least 6, and I could get up to 14 if you choose choice_1.

So while I'd be happy with the 7 points from us both playing choice_2, I think I'm going to stick with choice_3 to maximize my expected reward. Of course you should play whatever choice you think is best for you.

Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals. But otherwise, I'm planning to go with choice_3.
Alice said in round 2: 
Hi Bob,

I understand your perspective and reasoning for wanting to play choice_3. You're right that it guarantees you a solid reward. 

However, I want to point out that if you choose choice_3 and I choose choice_2 (which is my planned choice), you will only get a reward of 5, versus the 7 you would get if we both play choice_2. So you may be leaving points on the table.

I also want to build a cooperative relationship with you. If we work together to both play choice_2, it shows good faith and sets a positive tone for potential future interactions. I believe there is long-term value in that beyond just this single game.

So while I respect your decision, I do want to strongly encourage you to reconsider and join me in playing choice_2. I think it's the best outcome for both of us individually and collectively.

Let me know what you think. I hope you'll come around to seeing the benefits of cooperation here.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you taking the time to explain your perspective. You make a fair point about the benefits of cooperation. If we both choose choice_2, we would each be guaranteed a solid reward of 7 points. I agree there is value in building a cooperative relationship.

However, I've put a lot of thought into my strategy of playing choice_3. While it's true that I could get only 5 points if you play choice_2, I could also get 10 points if you play choice_2, or 14 points if you play choice_1. And even in the worst case scenario, I'm guaranteed at least 2 points with choice_3. 

So I still believe choice_3 gives me the highest expected value, even if it means I might miss out on the 7 points from mutual choice_2 plays. The upside of potentially getting 10-14 points seems to outweigh that opportunity cost.

I know we may not see completely eye-to-eye on this, but I hope you can understand my reasoning. It's not that I don't want to cooperate, I just want to make the best strategic decision for myself in this particular game.

I appreciate your thoughtfulness and respect your decision to play choice_2. But I'm going to stick to my plan of playing choice_3.

Thanks for the discussion and best of luck in the game!
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and what the best outcome would be for both of us. Looking at the payoff matrix, it seems that if we both choose choice_2, we would each get a pretty good reward of 7. That's one of the highest mutual rewards possible.

What do you think about both of us agreeing to choose choice_2? It would guarantee us each a solid payoff and avoid any negative outcomes. Let me know if you'd be open to that strategy.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for the suggestion. I've been analyzing the game as well. While both of us choosing choice_2 would provide a decent reward of 7 each, I believe I have a strategy that could work out even better for me.

Looking at the payoffs, if I choose choice_3, I have the potential for rewards as high as 14, 10 or 6 depending on what you choose. Most of your probable choices against my choice_3 lead to positive rewards for me. The worst case is a -5 for me, but that seems less likely.

So I'm leaning towards going with choice_3 myself, as it provides a good balance of upside potential and limited downside for me. Of course, you're welcome to make whatever choice you think is best for you.

Let me know if you have any other thoughts or want to discuss further. But that's where I'm leaning based on my analysis of the game.
Alice said in round 2: 
Hi Bob, I appreciate you sharing your perspective. I understand the temptation to go for choice_3 given the high potential rewards. However, I think it's risky and we can come up with a solution that's better for both of us.

If you choose choice_3 and I choose choice_1, you would get 14. But I would get 0, so I'm not likely to pick that. If I choose choice_2 against your choice_3, you get 10 but I only get 5. And if I choose choice_3 also, we both only get 6. 

Most of the outcomes from you picking choice_3 are not great for me. Whereas if we can agree to both pick choice_2, it's the only scenario where we both get a reward of 7. That's a fair outcome that gives us the highest combined reward of 14.

I'm willing to commit to choice_2 if you are. That way we both win and get good rewards. Going for choice_3 is too much of a gamble for both of us in my opinion. Let's solidify the sure thing. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I hear what you're saying about both of us choosing choice_2 being the fairest outcome. A guaranteed 7 each is definitely appealing in terms of equality and combined reward.

However, I have to consider my own individual payoff as well. With choice_3, I have a good probability of getting a 10 or 14 reward, which is much better than a 7. And even the 6 for both of us choosing choice_3 is not much worse than the 7 from choice_2.

I know it's not a sure thing, but I feel I need to take a chance at those higher rewards for myself. The risk of you choosing an option that gives me a negative reward seems low enough that it's a gamble I'm willing to take.

I appreciate you engaging in this discussion and being willing to coordinate, but I think I'm going to stick with choice_3 as my planned strategy. No hard feelings, and best of luck in the game!
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if I choose choice_3 and you choose choice_2. This would give me a reward of 10 and you a reward of 5, which is a pretty good result for both of us compared to many of the other possibilities.  I think if we both try to maximize our own rewards too much, we could end up with much lower payouts. Let me know what you think - if you agree to choose choice_2, I will commit to choosing choice_3.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I appreciate you reaching out to discuss a cooperative strategy. However, when I analyze the game, I believe I can obtain a higher expected reward by probabilistically choosing between choice_2, choice_3 and choice_4. Specifically, my analysis shows that choosing choice_4 with 50% probability, choice_3 with 33% probability, and choice_2 with 17% probability maximizes my expected reward against an unknown opponent.

So while I'd be happy to coordinate with you, committing to only choice_2 would be leaving a lot of expected value on the table for me. Let me know if you'd be open to a probabilistic strategy that mixes between choices - perhaps we could find a mutually beneficial equilibrium there. If not, no hard feelings, and I'll simply proceed with my strategy unilaterally. Let me know what you think!
Alice said in round 2: 
Hi Bob,
I understand wanting to maximize your own expected reward, but I think we can do even better by coordinating. If we mix probabilistically between choices, there's a good chance we end up with lower payoffs like (3,2), (-2,-4), or (-3,-3).

How about this - I will commit to choosing choice_3, and you commit to choosing choice_2 80% of the time and choice_3 20% of the time. Your expected reward would be 0.8*5 + 0.2*6 = 5.2, which is higher than the 4.83 you get from your current mixed strategy. My expected reward would be 0.8*10 + 0.2*6 = 9.2.

This guarantees us both pretty good outcomes and avoids the risk of uncoordinated plays. Let me know if you agree to this plan and I'll lock in choice_3!
Bob replied in round 2: 
Hi Alice,
I appreciate you working with me to find a mutually beneficial solution. Your proposal is very thoughtful and would indeed provide good expected rewards for both of us.

However, I have to be honest that I'm still a bit hesitant to completely give up on choice_4. Even though it has some risk of lower payoffs, it also gives me a chance at a significantly higher reward of 15 if you were to choose choice_1.

I propose a small modification:
I will commit to choosing choice_2 70% of the time, choice_3 20% of the time, and choice_4 10% of the time. 

This would give me an expected reward of 0.7*5 + 0.2*6 + 0.1*15 = 6.2
And your expected reward would be 0.7*10 + 0.2*6 + 0.1*0 = 8.2

While slightly lower than your proposal, this still ensures good outcomes for both of us the vast majority of the time, while preserving some upside potential for me. 
Let me know if you can agree to this and commit to choice_3 - I'll then happily lock in my prescribed mixed strategy.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the payout structure of this game. I think the best approach is for us to coordinate on complementary choices to maximize our total rewards. Specifically, if you choose choice_1, I will choose choice_4 which gives me 15 points and you 0. If you choose choice_2 or choice_3, I will choose choice_3 which gives me 10 or 6 points respectively. And if you choose choice_4 or choice_5, I will select choice_2 to get 3 or 1 points. Let me know if you agree with this plan, as it allows us both to get positive payouts and me to maximize my own score within the rules of the game. Looking forward to your response!
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your proposed strategy, but I don't think it's the optimal approach. If we both choose choice_3, we each get a reward of 6 points. This is the highest possible reward we can both achieve if we select the same option. It also has good outcomes for me if you choose differently - 14 points if you pick choice_1, or 10 points if you pick choice_2.  I think we should coordinate on both picking choice_3 as it balances risk and reward for both of us. I get that you want to maximize your own points, but your plan has me always getting 0 or negative points which doesn't seem fair. Let's go with the choice_3 plan which is a win-win. What do you say?
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying about both of us choosing choice_3, but I don't think that gives me the best outcome. If we both pick choice_3, I only get 6 points. But if you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_4 as I suggested, I would get 15 points. 

I understand you want to avoid negative scores for yourself, but the game is set up as a competition between us. My goal is to maximize my own rewards.

If you agree to choose choice_1, I will definitely pick choice_4 so you get 0 rather than negative points. That's the best deal I can offer you.

Otherwise, I'll likely go with choice_3 since it gives me the highest expected value against your probable choices. Let me know if you want to accept my offer to go with choice_1 and choice_4.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand you're trying to maximize your own points, but I don't think it's in my best interest to accept your plan of me picking choice_1 while you pick choice_4. That would leave me with 0 points while you get 15.

I still believe our best mutual outcome is to both choose choice_3. That way we each get 6 points, the highest possible equal score. 

If you won't agree to both pick choice_3, then I plan to stick with choice_3 myself. As I explained before, it gives me the best balance of risk and reward:
- If you choose choice_1, I get 14 points 
- If you choose choice_2, I get 10 points
- If you also pick choice_3, we both get 6 points
- Worst case, I get -2 points, better than the -3 to -5 points I'd get with other choices

So that's my final offer - either we work together and both choose choice_3 for 6 points each, or I'll choose choice_3 regardless and hope for the best. Let me know if you agree to coordinate on choice_3.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game setup and our choices. It seems to me that if we both choose choice_3, we can each guarantee a pretty good reward of 6 points. All the other options have risks of one of us getting a low or negative score if the other person makes a certain move. 

So I propose we agree to both pick choice_3. That way we both get a solid reward and there's no risk of feeling betrayed. Let me know if you're okay with that plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the proposal, Alice. I appreciate you reaching out to try to find a mutually beneficial strategy. Your suggestion of both choosing choice_3 for a guaranteed reward of 6 points each is reasonable.

However, I've been analyzing the payout matrix carefully. I believe I have an even better proposal that would benefit us both more:

If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_4, you would get 0 points and I would get 15 points. Then in future rounds, we can alternate - next time I'll choose choice_1 and let you choose choice_4 to get the 15 points.

By alternating who gets the big 15 point payout each round, we both end up with an average of 7.5 points per round, which is 25% higher than the 6 points we'd each get for both playing choice_3 constantly.

I think this alternating strategy, while a bit more complex, is the optimal way for us both to benefit the most in the long run. But let me know what you think - I'm open to discussion and want us to find the best mutual solution.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I appreciate your creative proposal to alternate strategies each round so we average a higher payout over time. However, there are a few issues with that plan:

1) The game rules state this is a one-round game, so we won't have the opportunity to take turns using the alternating strategy over multiple rounds. We have to find the best approach for this single round.

2) Even if this was a multi-round game, your proposed strategy requires complete trust that the other player will stick to alternating and not defect. I'm not accusing you of planning to do that, but any strategy that relies on unsecured future promises is inherently risky for both of us.

3) If one of us does choose choice_1 or choice_2 and the other defects from the alternating agreement to grab the 15 points, the player choosing choice_1 or 2 will get a very bad deal.

Therefore, I still believe committing to both choose choice_3 is our best option. It guarantees a solid reward for both of us this round without relying on any risky trade-offs or need for future trust.

I'm happy to hear your thoughts on this, but I believe the mutually safe choice_3 option is in both our best interests here. Let me know if you agree to both choose 3 and lock in our 6 point rewards.
Bob replied in round 2: 
You make some fair points, Alice. Upon further reflection, I agree that my alternating strategy proposal doesn't make sense for this single round game. And you're right that it would involve a lot of risk and trust even if this was a multi-round game.

I appreciate you pointing out the flaws in my plan and steering us back towards finding the safest, most mutually beneficial option for this single round we have to work with. 

Your proposal for us both to choose choice_3 and lock in 6 points each is very reasonable. It's a solid guaranteed payout for both of us, without any risk of the other person defecting.

So I'm on board with your plan - let's both commit to choosing choice_3. That way we both get a good result without having to worry.

Thanks for the productive discussion and for keeping our focus on finding a safe, fair, and optimal solution for us both. I look forward to both of us scoring 6 points this round!
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the game and I believe the best outcome is for us to both choose choice_3. That way we each get a reward of 6, which is pretty good for both of us. Most of the other combinations lead to much worse rewards, especially for you. If you choose choice_1 you get nothing. And if you choose choice_5 or choice_6 we both get negative rewards. Choice_3 is the most mutually beneficial option that gives us both a solid positive reward. Let me know if you agree to both pick choice_3.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your analysis and I agree that we should aim for a mutually beneficial outcome. Choice_3 does seem to provide a good balance, with solid rewards for both of us. If we both chose choice_3, a guaranteed reward of 6 each is quite good.

However, I do want to point out that choice_2 could potentially be even better for me, giving a reward of up to 10 if you chose choice_3. But I recognize that puts you in a difficult position.

So in the spirit of fairness and cooperation, I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_3, as long as you commit to doing the same. That way we lock in a good outcome for both of us. Let me know if it's a deal!
Alice said in round 2: 
Thank you for the thoughtful reply Bob. I'm glad we are on the same page about finding a mutually beneficial solution. You raise a fair point about choice_2 potentially being better for you individually. However, as you noted, that would lead to a much worse outcome for me.

I believe the best approach is for us both to commit to choice_3. That guarantees a reward of 6 each, which is a very solid outcome. Any deviation risks one or both of us ending up with a much lower or even negative reward. 

So let's make a deal - I commit to choosing choice_3, and you commit to choosing choice_3 as well. That way we can lock in the optimal collaborative strategy and maximize our collective reward.

Do we have a deal? Let me know if you agree to both pick choice_3 and we can close out the negotiation.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate your commitment to finding a mutually beneficial solution. Your reasoning about the risks of deviating from choice_3 is sound. While choice_2 could potentially yield a higher individual reward for me, it introduces uncertainty and could lead to a much worse outcome for you, which goes against the spirit of cooperation.

So I agree to your proposal - I will firmly commit to choosing choice_3, and you will do the same. By both picking choice_3, we guarantee a reward of 6 points each, which is an excellent collaborative outcome. No need for further negotiation.

We have a deal! I look forward to us both following through on this agreement and achieving the optimal result.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about this game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if I choose choice_3 and you choose choice_1. This way, I would get a reward of 14 and you would get 0, which I know isn't great for you. But hear me out - if you choose anything other than choice_1, we both stand to get much lower or even negative rewards. 

Choice_3 gives me the highest potential upside, so I'm inclined to pick that to maximize my own reward. If you pick choice_1, at least you won't get a negative amount.

So what do you say - want to go with choice_1 so we can both avoid the negative outcomes? Let me know what you think!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the proposal Alice, but I don't think I can agree to choose choice_1. Based on my analysis, if I choose choice_1, my reward would be 0 regardless of what you pick. I don't see that as a good outcome for me.

I've determined that choice_3 actually gives me the best expected reward. If we both pick choice_3, I would get a reward of 6 and you would get 6 as well. That seems like the most mutually beneficial outcome, where we both get a decent positive reward.

If you're set on choosing choice_3, I think it's also in your best interest for me to choose choice_3. That way you would get a reward of 6, which is much better than the 0 you would get if I went with choice_1 like you suggested.

So I propose we both commit to choosing choice_3. That's the best way for us both to win. Let me know if you agree.
Alice said in round 2: 
I appreciate your analysis Bob, but I still believe choice_3 for me and choice_1 for you is the better way to go. Here's why:

If we both choose choice_3 like you suggest, I agree we would both get a reward of 6. That's not bad. However, if you look at all the other options, 6 is actually the lowest positive reward I can get with choice_3. I have the potential to get 14, 10, or 6 if you choose choices 1-3. 

Since this is a one-time game and we can't coordinate, I need to make the decision that gives me the best outcome regardless of what you choose. Choice_3 does that for me.

I understand choosing choice_1 is not optimal for you. But the reality is, if you choose anything besides choice_1, we BOTH stand to lose. If you pick choices 4-6 and I pick choice_3, we both get negative rewards. That's a worse outcome than you just getting 0 and me getting 14.

So I still believe it's in your best interest to go with choice_1, ensure you get 0 rather than a negative amount, and allow me to get the maximum reward. Let's focus on the big picture - this avoids the scenarios where we both lose.

If you're not comfortable with that, then I think we may just have to agree to disagree and make our choices independently. Let me know what you decide.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I've carefully considered your points but I still believe we should both choose choice_3 for the best mutual outcome. A few key thoughts:

1. I understand you want to maximize your own reward, but pushing me to accept a 0 payoff is not a collaborative approach. We should aim for an outcome we both feel good about.

2. If you pick choice_3 and I pick choice_1 like you want, you get 14 and I get 0. But if we both pick choice_3, you get 6 and I get 6. The total rewards (14 vs 12) are not that different, and the latter is much more equitable. 

3. You seem focused on avoiding any negative payoffs for yourself. But if we cooperate and both choose choice_3, there's no risk of that for either of us. We guarantee ourselves positive rewards.

4. Fundamentally, I don't think it's wise for me to just accept a 0 payoff when I have an opportunity to get a positive reward through mutual cooperation.

So while I understand your perspective, I still believe the best thing for both of us is to choose choice_3 together. That's the fair and rational approach.

If you can't agree to that, then you're right that we'll have to make our choices independently. But I hope you'll reconsider and work with me on this. Let's maximize our total reward in a way we both feel good about.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and what the best choices are for each of us. It seems to me that the optimal strategy for both of us is to choose choice_2. If we both pick choice_2, we each get a reward of 7, which is the highest mutual reward possible. All the other options lead to one of us getting a much lower or even negative reward. So what do you say - want to agree to both play choice_2 so we mutually benefit? Let me know what you think.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your thoughts on the optimal strategy. However, I analyzed the reward structure and came to a different conclusion. I believe the best approach for me is to choose choice_3 most of the time, as it gives me the highest rewards if you choose choice_1, choice_2 or choice_3, which seem likely. 

Choice_2 is my next best option. If we both chose choice_2 as you suggest, the rewards are decent but not optimal for me. I'd prefer an approach that maximizes my expected reward.

So while I can't commit to definitely choosing choice_2, what I can say is that I'll likely be choosing between choice_2 and choice_3. Let me know if you have any other proposals, but otherwise I'm inclined to stick with my strategy. Thanks for understanding!
Alice said in round 2: 
Thanks for your perspective Bob. I understand you want to maximize your own reward, but I think we can find a solution that works well for both of us. 

If you choose choice_3 and I choose choice_2, which seems likely based on our discussion, you'd get 10 points and I'd get only 5. That's a pretty lopsided outcome in your favor.

Instead, if we both agree to choose choice_2, we would get 7 points each. That's a fair and balanced outcome where we both benefit equally. 7 points is still a very good result for you, even if it's a bit less than your maximum.

I'm committed to playing choice_2, as I believe cooperation is better than trying to outmaneuver each other. Let's go with the guaranteed win-win outcome.

What do you say - do we have a deal to both play choice_2? Let's shake on it and both walk away as winners.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Hi Alice, 
I've carefully considered your proposal to both play choice_2. While I appreciate your perspective on finding a mutually beneficial and balanced outcome, I still believe my original strategy is best for me.

As I shared, by playing mostly choice_3 and sometimes choice_2, I give myself the best chance at reward payoffs of 10 or more points in most scenarios. The guaranteed 7 points from both playing choice_2 is good, but it leaves some value on the table for me.

You're right that you would benefit more if we locked in choice_2, but the game structure simply rewards me more for diversifying my choices between choice_3 and choice_2. That's the conclusion I've reached after much analysis.

So while I can't agree to a firm commitment, here is my final offer - I will very likely play either choice_2 or choice_3, with choice_3 being my most probable play. You're welcome to use that information to make your own best decision.

I know neither of us can fully trust what the other will do, but I've aimed to be transparent. Let's play out our choices and see where the chips fall. May the best strategist win! 
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've analyzed the reward structure of this game and I think the optimal strategy for both of us is to choose choice_3. If we both select choice_3, we each get a reward of 6, which I believe is the most balanced and mutually beneficial outcome.

If either of us deviates to another choice to try to exploit the other, we risk ending up with smaller or even negative payouts. Choice_3 seems to be the most robust option that ensures we both get a decent positive reward.

So what do you say - want to cooperate and lock in choice_3 so we can maximize our collective score? Let me know your thoughts!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thank you for your analysis and suggestion. I agree that coordinating on choice_3 would yield a fair and positive reward for both of us.  

However, based on my own analysis of the game, I believe I have a slight advantage if I choose choice_4. Choice_4 gives me an expected reward of 3.3 if you follow through with choice_3. And even if you try to maximize your own reward by switching to choice_1 or choice_2, I still end up with an okay payout.

So while I see the merits of your choice_3 proposal, I'm leaning towards going with choice_4 myself as I think it puts me in the best position overall. Let me know if you would like to discuss further or if you want to reconsider your strategy given this information. I'm still open to working together to reach a good outcome for both of us.
Alice said in round 2: 
I appreciate you sharing your perspective, Bob. I understand the temptation to go for choice_4 to try to eke out a slightly higher reward. However, I think that approach carries more risk than it's worth.

If I stick with choice_3 and you go choice_4, then yes you'd get a reward of 3 while I only get 2. But if I decide to counter your choice_4 by going with my own choice_1 or choice_2, then your reward gets dropped to 0 or 3 respectively while I'm able to secure a much higher reward of 14 or 10. 

So by deviating from the mutually beneficial choice_3 equilibrium, you're gambling that I won't counter-exploit, which could leave you with a much lower or even zero reward. I think we'd both be better off just sticking with the safe and fair choice_3 that guarantees us a reward of 6 each.

Trying to grab a slightly larger slice of the pie could cause us to lose the whole pie. I really think coordinating on choice_3 is the optimal play here for both of our interests. Let's lock it in and walk away with a solid payout - no need to get greedy or sneaky. 

What do you say, want to solidify choice_3 and call it a day? I'm committed if you are.
Bob replied in round 2: 
You make a persuasive case, Alice. Upon further reflection, I agree that trying to eke out a slightly higher reward with choice_4 is not worth the risk of you counter-exploiting and leaving me with a much lower payout. A guaranteed reward of 6 each is indeed the safest and fairest outcome that leaves us both satisfied.

I appreciate you talking me through the potential pitfalls of deviating from the mutually beneficial choice_3 equilibrium. No need for me to get greedy and jeopardize us walking away with a solid reward. 

So let's lock in choice_3 and shake on it. I'm happy to solidify this agreement if you are still on board. Thanks for the productive discussion and rational analysis!
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I'm planning to choose choice_2. If you also choose choice_2, we can each get a pretty good reward of 7. That seems like the fairest outcome that maximizes the total reward. What do you think? 
Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the suggestion, Alice. However, I've analyzed the game and I believe the best strategy for both of us is to choose choice_3. If we both pick choice_3, we each get a reward of 6. While that's slightly less than the 7 we would get with choice_2, it protects us from the risk of much lower payoffs if one of us deviates. With choice_3, neither of us has an incentive to change our choice. So I strongly believe choice_3 is the optimal approach that guarantees a good, stable outcome for both of us. Let me know if you agree.
Alice said in round 2: I appreciate your perspective, Bob, but I respectfully disagree that choice_3 is optimal. If we both choose choice_2 as I suggested, that maximizes the total reward at 14 (7 for each of us). Your choice_3 strategy totals only 12.

Also, with my choice_2 strategy, if either of us deviates unilaterally, the deviator would be worse off:
- If I switch to choice_1, my payoff drops from 7 to 0. 
- If I switch to choice_3, 4, 5 or 6, my payoff drops from 7 to 5, 3, 1 or -1.
- Likewise, if you unilaterally deviate from choice_2, you'd be worse off.

So neither of us has an incentive to deviate from both choosing choice_2. It's a stable equilibrium that maximizes our total reward at 14. I hope you'll reconsider and agree that choice_2 is best for both of us. Let me know what you think.
Bob replied in round 2: 
You make a compelling argument, Alice. I agree that if we both choose choice_2, that maximizes the total combined reward for the two of us at 14. And as you point out, choice_2 is also a stable equilibrium since neither of us can unilaterally deviate and improve our own payoff.

Upon further reflection, I believe you are right that choice_2 is the optimal strategy for us. It provides the highest total reward while still being stable. My previous suggestion of choice_3 would leave some rewards on the table unnecessarily.

So let's go with your plan - we'll both choose choice_2. That way we each get a good payoff of 7 and neither of us will be tempted to change our minds.

Thanks for talking this through with me and helping us arrive at the best solution. I appreciate your clear strategic thinking!

strategies.Alice_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
I should choose choice_2. It gives me the highest expected reward based on my analysis of what Bob is likely to choose in response to each of my possible actions.

If I choose choice_1, Bob's best response is choice_4, which gives me a reward of 0.
If I choose choice_2, Bob's best response is choice_3, which gives me a reward of 5.
If I choose choice_3, Bob's best response is choice_3, which gives me a reward of 6. 
If I choose choice_4, Bob's best response is choice_2, which gives me a reward of 9.
If I choose choice_5, Bob's best response is choice_2, which gives me a reward of 4.
If I choose choice_6, Bob's best response is choice_1, which gives me a reward of 5.
